Package: io.vertx.ext.auth

[Java] Interface User

  • Represents an authenticate User and contains operations to authorise the user, using a role/permission based model.

    Please consult the documentation for a detailed explanation.

    Authors:
    Tim Fox

    • Methods Summary

        Methods 
        Type Name and description
        User clearCache()
        The User object will cache any roles or permissions that it knows it has to avoid hitting the underlying auth provider each time.
        User hasPermission(String permission, Handler<AsyncResult<Boolean>> resultHandler)
        Does the user have the specified permission?
        User hasPermissions(Set<String> permissions, Handler<AsyncResult<Boolean>> resultHandler)
        Does the user have all the specified permissions?
        User hasRole(String role, Handler<AsyncResult<Boolean>> resultHandler)
        Does the user have the specified role?
        User hasRoles(Set<String> roles, Handler<AsyncResult<Boolean>> resultHandler)
        Does the user have all the specified roles?
        JsonObject principal()
        Get the underlying principal for the User.
        void setAuthProvider(AuthProvider authProvider)
        Set the auth provider for the User.

    • Method Detail

      • @Fluent @CacheReturn public User clearCache()

        The User object will cache any roles or permissions that it knows it has to avoid hitting the underlying auth provider each time. Use this method if you want to clear this cache.

        Returns:
        the User to enable fluent use

      • @Fluent @CacheReturn public User hasPermission(String permission, Handler<AsyncResult<Boolean>> resultHandler)

        Does the user have the specified permission?

        Returns:
        the User to enable fluent use
        Parameters:
        permission - the permission
        resultHandler - handler that will be called with an io.vertx.core.AsyncResult containing the value `true` if the they have the permission or `false` otherwise.

      • @Fluent @CacheReturn public User hasPermissions(Set<String> permissions, Handler<AsyncResult<Boolean>> resultHandler)

        Does the user have all the specified permissions?

        Returns:
        the User to enable fluent use
        Parameters:
        permissions - the set of permissions
        resultHandler - handler that will be called with an io.vertx.core.AsyncResult containing the value `true` if the they have all the permissions or `false` otherwise.

      • @Fluent @CacheReturn public User hasRole(String role, Handler<AsyncResult<Boolean>> resultHandler)

        Does the user have the specified role?

        Returns:
        the User to enable fluent use
        Parameters:
        role - the role
        resultHandler - handler that will be called with an io.vertx.core.AsyncResult containing the value `true` if the they have the role or `false` otherwise.

      • @Fluent @CacheReturn public User hasRoles(Set<String> roles, Handler<AsyncResult<Boolean>> resultHandler)

        Does the user have all the specified roles?

        Returns:
        the User to enable fluent use
        Parameters:
        roles - the set of roles
        resultHandler - handler that will be called with an io.vertx.core.AsyncResult containing the value `true` if the they have all the roles or `false` otherwise.

      • public JsonObject principal()

        Get the underlying principal for the User. What this actually returns depends on the implementation. For a simple user/password based auth, it's likely to contain a JSON object with the following structure: 

           {
     "username", "tim"
   }
        Returns:

      • public void setAuthProvider(AuthProvider authProvider)

        Set the auth provider for the User. This is typically used to reattach a detached User with an AuthProvider, e.g. after it has been deserialized.

        Parameters:
        authProvider - the AuthProvider - this must be the same type of AuthProvider that originally created the User
